title: 112_hr435
content: The Act titled "National Flood Insurance Program Termination Act of 2010" terminates the National Flood Insurance Program. The National Flood Insurance Program will terminate new coverage and renewals by the end of December 31, 2013. Existing coverage under contracts before this date will not be affected. After December 31, 2013, the National Flood Insurance Program will cease new coverage and renewals. The Administrator will wind up the program's affairs, using funds from the National Flood Insurance Fund for existing coverage. Unexpended balances will be deposited in the Treasury. The repeals made by section 3 of the law will not affect any prior orders, determinations, regulations, or contracts related to the National Flood Insurance Program. These will remain in effect until modified or terminated by authorized officials or through legal processes. The National Flood Insurance Program proceedings, including rulemaking notices, will continue after the repeals take effect. Orders issued in these proceedings will remain in effect until modified or revoked. The National Flood Insurance Program proceedings, including rulemaking notices, will continue after the repeals take effect. Orders issued in these proceedings will remain in effect until modified, terminated, superseded, or revoked by the Administrator, a court, or by operation of law. This section does not prohibit the discontinuance or modification of any proceeding under the same terms and conditions as if this section had not been enacted. This section will not affect suits commenced before the effective date of the repeals, and proceedings will continue as if this section had not been enacted. Liabilities incurred under the National Flood Insurance Program will not abate due to the enactment of this section. No cause of action related to the program against the Federal Emergency Management Agency or its officers will abate because of this section. The section repeals and continues FEMA mapping responsibilities.
